[{"id":"DEV-2686","entityId":"66-4489","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"Error handling for dual compass"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1569400416633"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2686"},{"name":"description","value":"

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

All

Affected Software Version(s)

2.17

Problem Description

Right now when there is a dual compass feature, it is enough that one compass is connected then we will never get a communication alarm for disconnected compass. Another issue is that if Gnss compass is disconnected we should use Silva compass, as heading source when we are running Go to Start position

Steps to Reproduce the Problem



Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1569512014744"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"DEV-2573","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_38-39"],"valueId":["2019_38-39"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.17"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.17"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["480"],"valueId":["1d"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2634","entityId":"66-4368","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add simulated module for the GNSS compass"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1567501370244"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2634"},{"name":"description","value":"

Look at the SimulatedPort from the QCT!

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1569512001558"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1569512001420"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"DEV-2573","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Fixed"],"valueId":["Fixed"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_38-39"],"valueId":["2019_38-39"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.17"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.17"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1407","entityId":"66-4474","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"1.6.0 RC4 / Send JPOS only one time"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Magnus Andersson"},{"name":"created","value":"1568974672927"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1407"},{"name":"description","value":"

The $JPOS,lat,lon<CR><LF> should only be sent one time after the power up to the GNSS module .
If the module receives a valid string it will respond $>

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1569493410354"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1569493410331"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1369","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Fixed"],"valueId":["Fixed"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_38-39"],"valueId":["2019_38-39"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.6"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.6"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5977","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-1407","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I have tested Qct, 190925 1556, 1.6.0_EA_02 and see an improvement. 10 start-up only one without GNSS after 40sec, started with GPS pos after 40s and then the GNSS was ok after 1:40sec.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1569486874836,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2632","entityId":"66-4364","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"Port GNSS protocol from QCT"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1567501142280"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2632"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Magnus Andersson"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1569389238539"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1569255720965"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"DEV-2573","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Fixed"],"valueId":["Fixed"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_38-39"],"valueId":["2019_38-39"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.17"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.17"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5954","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"DEV-2632","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The idea with the design solution is that the GNSS module will be pre-configured in the production with external equipment.
GNSS module will be configured to have the following data output @ 19200 baud and with a update freq of 10Hz.

Message
Format
$PSAT,HPR,TIME,HEADING,PITCH,ROLL,TYPE*CC<CR><LF>

where:

Message
Component
Description

TIME UTC time (HHMMSS.SS)
HEADING Heading (degrees)
PITCH Pitch (degrees)
ROLL Roll (degrees)
TYPE N = GPS derived heading
G = gyro heading
*CC Checksum
<CR> Carriage return
<LF> Line feed

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1567518611231,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5974","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"DEV-2632","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The implementation is now with a update freq of 1Hz. The RS232 switch toggles with 5s slots between the compass and the GNSS.
This means that 2 messages is received from the compass and 4 from the GNSS.
Note this is only valid when the GNSS has a Head lock signal because this enables the toggling

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1569389238549,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2633","entityId":"66-4366","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add stow procedure for GNSS"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1567501246126"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2633"},{"name":"description","value":"

Problem Description

Since the compass antennas will be mounted on the back of the main reflector, the antenna must be in stow position when we retrieve compass heading.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1569337274337"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1569337274281"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"DEV-2573","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Fixed"],"valueId":["Fixed"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_38-39"],"valueId":["2019_38-39"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.17"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.17"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["2400"],"valueId":["1w"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-833","entityId":"66-2506","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"NMEA warning for GPS module"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Peter Bladh"},{"name":"created","value":"1457606099731"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"833"},{"name":"description","value":"
From document D1401-058 by MBO!

Add warning for the event that the NMEA string (latitude/longitude) from the RFX GPS receiver (10 MHz module) is corrupt. Change the source from Hemisphere H200 to RFX module.

Add warning for the event that the NMEA string (system time) from the RFX GPS receiver (10 MHz module) is corrupt.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"peb"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1567599260176"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1567599260141"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-912","type":"Depend","role":"depends on"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Won't fix"],"valueId":["Won't fix"],"color":null},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_36-37"],"valueId":["2019_36-37"],"color":null},{"name":"Planned Release","value":["1.6.0"],"valueId":["1.6.0"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5088","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-833","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
See smb://dps-file01/company/development/01.%20RCSE%20PROJECTS/10.%20FY2014/D1401%20Manpack/04.%20Verifying%20Project%20documents/04.%20Validation%20Protocol/D1401-058 QCT90 SW APP 1.0.0 Candidate Findings.xlsx
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1499086471674,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5957","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-833","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I suggest to put this into wont fix.
If there is a corrupt NMEA string the data should not be used. When we receive a valid GPGGA string with a valid pos we cant decide if the position is wrong.
I think that the idea with this "candidate findings" was to have a function that support a override function between the Hemisphere and RFX module and this has been implemented in the 1.6.0 RC3

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1567598972564,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1279","entityId":"66-4095","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Admin Tool / SW upgrade / No confirmation after reboot"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Mikael Borin"},{"name":"created","value":"1559140027438"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1279"},{"name":"description","value":"
In the Admin Tool after a SW upgrade, there is no confirmation after reboot.
The reason is that the M&C IP address has been set to default and the web server is stopped.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mbo"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1567522994485"},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Planned Release","value":["1.6.0"],"valueId":["1.6.0"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.6"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.6"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5956","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1279","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
After we reinstall a unit and reboots, the OS thinks it is starting for the first time and cleans all data files, including our databases and configuration files.

We need to send a question to Hectronic regarding this behaviour.

Also, we can't reproduce this on our lab boards. We need help from Magnus Andersson to build a new lab board with a recent main boards.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1567522994488,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2528","entityId":"66-4025","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"Report from customer. System mute at 59deg"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Jonas Lindberg"},{"name":"created","value":"1557472063791"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2528"},{"name":"description","value":"

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)


CCT120

Affected Software Version(s)



Problem Description


The system has stopped transmission the moment the temp reached 59 C inside the system. The customer observes that they had specified operations upto 55 C ambient temp but the system is failing at 45 C itself.

Steps to Reproduce the Problem



Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"jln"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1559633783296"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1559633783285"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Won't fix"],"valueId":["Won't fix"],"color":null},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_22_23"],"valueId":["2019_22_23"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.16"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.16"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["240"],"valueId":["4h"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"Unscheduled","id":"Development:Unscheduled"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5826","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"DEV-2528","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Couldn't find any relation between temperature and transmission in our code base. Jonas Lindberg will test this and check if the HPA is muting itself under high temperature.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1558513871770,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2545","entityId":"66-4042","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"GPS is not responding, happens for two units "},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1557825341325"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2545"},{"name":"description","value":"

Problem Description

GPS is not showing any values and there is an alarm. This happens for 3 units. See the picture for more clarification.

Steps to Reproduce the Problem



Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1558348726286"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1557833944520"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Won't fix"],"valueId":["Won't fix"],"color":null},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_20_21"],"valueId":["2019_20_21"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.16"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.16"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"Unscheduled","id":"Development:Unscheduled"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1.png","id":"85-1289","url":"http://dps-sw-youtrack.corp.datapath.com:8999/_persistent/image1.png?file=85-1289&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5789","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"DEV-2545","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Seems that this was something related to hardware. By starting the system issue was fixed.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1557834020030,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2530","entityId":"66-4027","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"System can't be stowed after AR without cancel and go to start position"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Daniel Brännström"},{"name":"created","value":"1557478865320"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2530"},{"name":"description","value":"

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

All? Newtec and SCPC, AS200-6 and AS 120-4 tested

Affected Software Version(s)

2.16.1_RC6

Problem Description

After a Auto Resume has been performed and "stop" has been press to take over control you are in the transmit page. The only option here is to press "cancel" and start the wizard again from scratch. >You can't pess "Next" to go to stow page. And the "Finish" page is not lit in the left column. See picture:
http://dps-sw-youtrack.corp.datapath.com:8999/_persistent/No_stow_transmit.PNG?file=85-1280&v=0&c=true&rw=800&rh=600
Even if you press "Cancel" the "Finish" page is not lit.
The only option to stow the antenna is to step through wizard to the "Setup" page. Press the "Go To Start Position" and wait for the setup to finish before you can reach the "Finish" page and do a stow of the system

Steps to Reproduce the Problem

See above.

Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

Possible to stow the antenna after AR without performing a "Go To Start Position" first.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Daniel Brännström"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"dbr"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"dbr"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1557818593433"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1557818593423"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["System Tested"],"valueId":["System Tested"],"color":{"bg":"#0050a1","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2019_20_21"],"valueId":["2019_20_21"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.16"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.16"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"Unscheduled","id":"Development:Unscheduled"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"No_stow_transmit.PNG","id":"85-1280","url":"http://dps-sw-youtrack.corp.datapath.com:8999/_persistent/No_stow_transmit.PNG?file=85-1280&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5775","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"DEV-2530","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
This might be solved due to recent changes in autoresume/Radyne.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1557479139474,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5785","author":"dbr","authorFullName":"Daniel Brännström","issueId":"DEV-2530","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I looks like in 2.16.1_RC7 when using "Newtec" the next button is still not available. But after pressing "Cancel" the "Finish" page is available and the system can be stowed without the need to use "Go To Start Position" first. This is OK in my opinion.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1557750542836,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5787","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"DEV-2530","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Next button was not activated during transmission in newtec case. However Daniel Brännström will test if this is working with scpc
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1557751643088,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5788","author":"dbr","authorFullName":"Daniel Brännström","issueId":"DEV-2530","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Seems OK both with SCPC and Newtec. Nothing can be done until transmission is muted (not changing level of modem, and HPA for SCPC either) but after mute next and stow can be pressed for both Newtec and SCPC. And if transmission is started again the level for SCPC can also be changed. Seems like a good and working solution.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1557754468303,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2485","entityId":"66-3979","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"Cant calculate pointing solution"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Magnus Andersson"},{"name":"created","value":"1555483349158"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2485"},{"name":"description","value":"

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

Personalities:
TU: Ka-band 30/20GHz 35W [10]
NP: L-Band [2]
AS: CCT120 BB LNB 10MHZ CONTROL [11]
CU: IP 65 ETX V3 [3]
AUX: None [-1]

Affected Software Version(s)

Version: 2.15.3, Build Date: 20190411, SVN Revision: 19796, Base Revision: 19679, Installation Type: patch_install, Ed

Problem Description

Cant calculate pointing solution even that the GPS has valid info if I override the GPS data its ok.
The problem doesn't seem to appear with NP SCPC.

Steps to Reproduce the Problem

The same HW worked fine with 2.16 RC5.


Additional Information

In the navigation toll the GPS have quality "NO FIX" but the NMEA show a valid fix.

Expected Result/Finished Criteria

Jonsson","issueId":"DEV-2251","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Hughes process the following commands/statuses from Antenna:
a Alive Interval
i ID of the modem type
s Status of antenna
w Where the platform is located

Hughes send the following commands/status to Antenna:
A Alive Interval
B Beat frequency oscillator freq
F Find the satellite
L Lock
P Polarization
S Satellite Parameters Y
W Where interval Y
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1540381440860,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5506","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"DEV-2251","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
The customer will accept a Release Candidate when they are running these tests on December 1:st, so we will not have to make a complete release by then.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1540811706413,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Release Notes","cssClass":"c0"},{"value":"Backlog","cssClass":"c18"}]}, {"id":"DEV-2421","entityId":"66-3913","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"iDirect openAMIP C message implementation"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Jonas Lindberg"},{"name":"created","value":"1553010454620"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2421"},{"name":"description","value":"
= Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX) =CCT l-band


= Affected Software Version(s) =2.15.1 rc2


= Problem Description =there is no "c" received on UDP port 2002.
Carrier to Noise Ratio for Conical Scan.
Reporting rate is configured by "c" message.
Default "C" message rate is zero (if "c"
message reporting rate parameter is not
present, the "C" message is disabled). It is
recommended to provide this message by
UDP as a separate stream.


Steps to Reproduce the Problem



Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1549614503024,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"DEV-2082","entityId":"66-3396","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"DEV"},{"name":"summary","value":"error handling for StartInstallationCarrier"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1524660192833"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"2082"},{"name":"description","value":"

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

NP: 22

Affected Software Version(s)

2.14.0

Problem Description

Sometimes it is possible to get Success:false from StartInstallationCarrier with TextId: "Please proceed with terminal installation before starting an installation carrier."
In this cases we should run Sequence of installation again and then try to StartInstallationCarrier again.
Another situation is that modem is sending Installer Action demanded

Steps to Reproduce the Problem

login to modem GUI and change OdUType and beam frequencies to different values

Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

TU X, Ka

Affected Software Version(s)

2.13.2_RC2

Problem Description

When selecting a SCPC setup file with a fixed LNB selected in the SCPC section of the setup file the error message "The LNB selected in the selevted setup file doesn't match current LNB setting..."
is received.

Steps to Reproduce the Problem

Select a setup file on the start page in the GUI that has a fixed LNB selected

Additional Information



Expected Result/Finished Criteria

No error message

GetInstallationState is not what customer want based on Magnus Andersson. Waiting answer from newtec to check if there is a way to get these statuses
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1530014891453,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5418","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"DEV-2157","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Newtec has answered and currently, there is no way to get this status. However, they can implement this as a change request.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1532929610629,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1087","entityId":"66-3481","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Set RasberryPi 3 default ip to 192.168.168.168 for communication with SDRPlay"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1531412819487"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1087"},{"name":"description","value":"
Each Rasberry Pi 3 has a unique network interface name which consists of a constant and mac address.
Because of this right now the default pi address for communication between QCT and pi 3 is set to for wrong network interface and we should configure each pi 3 by checking the interface name with ifconfig and then updating network interface name at /etc/dhcpcd.conf on PI 3.

It will be much easier if we can configure this programatically.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1536851938996"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1536850749845"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Released"],"valueId":["Released"],"color":{"bg":"#2f9890","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Release","value":["1.4.1"],"valueId":["1.4.1"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2018_36-37"],"valueId":["2018_36-37"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.4"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.4"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["240"],"valueId":["4h"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5428","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"QCT-1087","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
